DbTransaction

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

Commit()

Commits the underlying database transaction and disposes this wrapper instance. After calling this method the transaction can no longer be used and the context's current transaction reference is cleared.

Declaration
public void Commit()
| Edit this page View Source

CommitAsync(CancellationToken)

Asynchronously commits the underlying transaction and disposes the wrapper.

public Task CommitAsync(CancellationToken ct = default)

Token used to cancel the asynchronous operation.

Dispose()

Disposes the transaction and clears it from the owning DbContext.

DisposeAsync()

Asynchronously disposes the transaction and clears it from the context.

Declaration
public ValueTask DisposeAsync()
Returns
Type Description
ValueTask

A task representing the dispose operation.
| Edit this page View Source

Rollback()

Rolls back the underlying database transaction and disposes this wrapper instance. Any changes made within the transaction are undone and the context is returned to a non-transactional state.

Declaration
public void Rollback()
| Edit this page View Source

Asynchronously rolls back the underlying transaction and disposes the wrapper.
